Summary: circular silver ball approx 8ft in diameter
trends: There have been no other sightings in Vancouver suburbs
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsIt was a sunny afternoon and myself and passenger were driving home from a dog show. We noticed a huge silver ball sitting at the edge of a farmers field. My initial thought is that it was a ball that they put on high lines for airplace safety, but then realized there were no such high lines in that area. We stopped to take a look and walked up to it about 10 ft away. It made no noise, it looked solid, it had no seams, it was not a balloon, it was approx 8ft in diameter. I then felt uncomfortable because It just didn't feel right. We left and told the family when we got home what a strange anomoly we saw. We passed by the next day and it was gone. I never thought about it again until the local Vancouver UFO society mentioned that there was a multiple sightings of silver balls in the sky over Vancouver around that same time in 2000 or 2001. Now, the other strange anomily I have seen in my lifetime was in England, when I was 12 yrs old. I went to Timperely village, in Cheshire, with my girlfriend and stopped along with all the other folk to see 5 silver balls falling from the sky, all attached by silver rods. When they got to a certain height, they dettached from the rods and fell to the earth. No noise. We ran home all excited and told my parents, who dismissed it as imagination. Strange coincidences:
